titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ralph Gibson photographs, 2019 RL.11868
titlestmt.author: Paula Jeannet

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Ralph Gibson is an American photographer based in New York, N.Y. Collection consists of 208 photographs taken by Gibson in 2019 for his photobook, Sacred Land: Israel before and after time(2020). In addition to the 188 small single-image printer's proof prints, there are 20 large diptych prints, in which juxtaposed color and black-and-white images explore the nature of Israel and surrounding regions of Galilee, Jordan, and Palestine, through contemporary and ancient landscapes, architecture, city and country scenes, and portraits of a wide variety of people. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ralph Gibson is an American photographer based in New York City. His most recent photobook, Sacred Land: Israel before and after time, was published in 2020.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. Images may only be used for educational, non-commercial purposes; any other use requires permission. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Ralph Gibson photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ralph Gibson photographs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed and described by Paula Jeannet, February 2021.
Accession(s) represented in this collection guide: 2020-0084.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 188 individually printed 8 1/2 x 11 inch printer's proofs and 20 17 x 22 inch print diptychs by photographer Ralph Gibson, from his book Sacred Land: Israel before and after time, published in 2020 by Lustrum Press.

As a project, "Sacred Land" offers a portrait of Israel and the surrounding regions, including Palestine, Jordan, and Galilee, which juxtaposes past and contemporary experience through the narrative device of the diptych. Subjects include landscapes, rural and city life, found objects, architecture, antiquities, and portraits of a wide variety of people.
The untitled archival pigment inkjet prints are signed and dated by the photographer, and the printer's proofs are marked on the versos with the page numbers where the images appear in the photobook.

did.unittitle: Photographs from Sacred land: Israel before and after time
Diptychs from Sacred Land photobook project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This set of 20 color prints were produced as part of the Sacred Land project by photographer Ralph Gibson. They employ a diptych format to juxtapose images taken of the peoples, lands, and culture of Israel.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Archival pigment prints on 17 x 22 inch paper.

did.unittitle: Printer's proofs from Sacred Land photobook project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This large set of 188 printer's proofs consists of photographs taken by Ralph Gibson as he traveled throughout Israel in 2019, and used to create the photobook Sacred land: Israel before and after time, published in 2020 by Lustrum Press. Printed in color and black-and-white, the proofs measure 8 1/2 x 11 inches.
